featured.text: Also, the masters become so lazy that, after a while, they lose their muscles, and they become too weak ___(30)___ to feed themselves.
Scientists found that sharp corners are natural weak spots where stress concentrates.
Chemicals from the poisons kill reefs or make them weak, so they have less 37 to diseases.
Some—especially the elderly and those with weak immune systems—die.

other.text: Physically, Peter is well-built, yet , he is very weak and dependent.
If a sea snake was dried and weak, it drank more fresh water.

definition.zh_def: 弱的，力量或能力不足的。
definition.en_def: Lacking strength or power; not strong.
definition.example: He felt weak after running the marathon.
